programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: As far back as the Bronze Age, humans were building ships capable of crossing oceans and trading between continents; perhaps the greatest surviving vessel from the Ancient world, is The Mary Rose, Henry VIII's mighty warship.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: A dirty laboratory and a vacation lead to the discovery of the first real weapon against bacteria: penicillin; a scientist's determination to test the wrong solution makes Kevlar.

programme.title: Oops I Changed the World
programme.desc: Fumes from a broken thermometer cause the invention of photography; Radar parts and a melting snack bar lead to the microwave.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: Founded as a Phoenician colony on the African coast, Carthage rises to dominate the Western Mediterranean until being challenged by Rome in a series of three Punic Wars.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.sub-title: Miners: Fodder of the Industrial Revolution
programme.desc: Scottish inventor, mechanical engineer and chemist James Watt's steam engine innovations power the Industrial Revolution.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: After several months on the run, South African black leader Nelson Mandela is arrested by police and imprisoned on Robben Island off Cape Town in 1962, beginning a long ordeal.

programme.title: Butterfly Effect
programme.desc: After civil wars weaken the Roman Republic, Julius Caesar proclaims himself dictator for life. However, he is assassinated by Senate conspirators March 14, 44 B.C.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.sub-title: The Taj Mahal And The Golden Age Of Islam
programme.desc: Awe-inspiring palaces are the legacy that demonstrates the brilliance of Islamic engineers, working centuries before Western Europe began its own engineering revolution.

programme.title: Extinction: Going, Going, Gone
programme.desc: Studying the lifestyles and habitats of awe-inspiring creatures currently in danger to try to stem the tide of countless species from around the globe facing extinction.

programme.title: Power of Plants
programme.desc: Plants have cunning tricks, from shedding their leaves to producing antifreeze in order to escape the weather; they cover themselves in thorns and produce toxic chemicals to try and defend themselves from animals that want to eat them.

programme.title: Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Doug takes his drone to Kentucky where an unprecedented winter tornado has just ripped through.

programme.title: Doug to the Rescue
programme.desc: Using an infrared camera strapped onto his drone, Doug Thron travels to the heart of disaster zones to locate and rescue the animals who have been left behind.

programme.title: The Magic of the Wild
programme.desc: Yellowstone, the oldest national park on Earth, is famous for its diverse wildlife and a massive magma chamber in its depths that characterizes its distinctive landscapes.

programme.title: The Magic of the Wild
programme.desc: Visible from afar, Denali rises out of the Alaska Range at almost 6,200 meters; the highest mountain in North America is the eponym for one of the most spectacular national parks in the world.

programme.title: Jungle Guardian
programme.desc: Jungles contain up to 90% of the world's plant and animal species.

programme.desc: An attempt to bring World War II to a rapid close nets disastrous results in this adaptation of Cornelius Ryan's book.

programme.title: A Bridge Too Far
programme.desc: An attempt to bring World War II to a rapid close nets disastrous results in this adaptation of Cornelius Ryan's book.

programme.title: Captive
programme.desc: Recovering drug addict Ashley Smith (Kate Mara) reads Rick Warren's "The Purpose Driven Life" as armed fugitive Brian Nichols (David Oyelowo) holds her hostage in her apartment.

programme.title: Alive
programme.desc: Following the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan, injured veterans turn to adaptive athletics to heal their physical and emotional battle wounds.

programme.title: Summer Days, Summer Nights
programme.desc: On the south shore of Long Island in the summer of 1983, a group of working-class teenagers and 20-somethings work their summer jobs, fall in and out of love, and wrestle with what the future holds when the summer ends and the real world beckons.

programme.title: This is Christmas
programme.desc: Following Adam and Emma on their daily commute from the village of Langton to London, where they meet the same passengers every day.

programme.title: Serpico
programme.desc: Based on the true story of Frank Serpico, who sacrificed his career to expose widespread corruption in the NYPD.

programme.title: The Lovely Bones
programme.desc: A 14-year-old murder victim watches from heaven, as her family tries to heal and her killer continues on his own dark path.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: The secretary of Defense (Gene Hackman) forces a Pentagon naval aide (Kevin Costner) to lead a manhunt for a Soviet spy during a murder cover-up.

programme.title: Kiss the Girls
programme.desc: After escaping from a serial killer, a doctor (Ashley Judd) helps police and a forensic psychologist (Morgan Freeman) track the madman.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction
programme.desc: A New York lawyer (Michael Douglas) with a wife (Anne Archer) and daughter sleeps with a client (Glenn Close) whose lust turns to hate.

programme.title: The Wasp
programme.desc: Two estranged friends unveil a dangerous and deceptive plot that forever changes their lives.

programme.title: The Lovely Bones
programme.desc: A 14-year-old murder victim watches from heaven, as her family tries to heal and her killer continues on his own dark path.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Bumpy finds a new concrete supplier that subverts payments to the Italians; Elise and the Panthers plan a symbolic action against the police; Frank does a job for Colombo; Mayme asks James Baldwin to do a reading for the Fine Arts Board.

programme.title: The Horse Soldiers
programme.desc: A pacifist doctor (William Holden) joins a Union colonel's (John Wayne) cavalry raid in Confederate territory.

programme.title: The Horse Soldiers
programme.desc: A pacifist doctor (William Holden) joins a Union colonel's (John Wayne) cavalry raid in Confederate territory.

programme.title: Wild Bill
programme.desc: The legendary gunfighter (Jeff Bridges) resumes romance with Calamity Jane (Ellen Barkin), faces an upstart and copes with his past in late-1800s Dakota Territory.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: Old West drifters Jake (Kevin Costner), Emmett (Scott Glenn), Mal and Paden (Kevin Kline) shoot it out with a crooked sheriff and clan.

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: The mastermind (Steve McQueen) of a Boston bank caper falls in love with the insurance sleuth (Faye Dunaway) on his trail.

programme.title: The Duchess
programme.desc: Determined to be an important figure in affairs of state, the Duchess of Devonshire (Keira Knightley) rises to the forefront of the Whig Party in the late 1700s and ushers in reforms.

programme.title: Heaven Can Wait
programme.desc: Heavenly executive Mr. Jordan allows an angry quarterback (Warren Beatty), taken before his time, to return to Earth as a millionaire.

programme.title: French Girl
programme.desc: When his girlfriend gets swept away to Canada by a job offer from her ex, a hopeless romantic travels to her hometown, only to find himself out of his depth while trying to charm her hard-to-impress, French-speaking family.

programme.title: Wonder Boys
programme.desc: Terrified his second novel won't live up to the first and stumbling over his personal life, a writer (Michael Douglas) takes a gifted student (Tobey Maguire) under his wing.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop
programme.desc: A freewheeling Detroit cop pursuing a murder investigation finds himself dealing with the very different culture of Beverly Hills.

programme.title: Liar Liar
programme.desc: A boy's birthday wish comes true that his neglectful father, a fast-talking lawyer, cannot tell a lie for 24 hours.

programme.title: Airplane!
programme.desc: A pilot (Robert Hays) afraid to fly follows his stewardess ex-girlfriend (Julie Hagerty) and must take over for the poisoned crew.

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: Michael Crichton directed this adaptation of his novel chronicling the first robbery of a moving train in 1855.

programme.title: The Missouri Breaks
programme.desc: An eccentric gunfighter (Marlon Brando) for hire must protect a cattle baron's herd from a rustler (Jack Nicholson) and his gang.

programme.title: Year of the Dog
programme.desc: After her beloved beagle dies, an office worker unsuccessfully searches for ways to fill the void in her life.

programme.title: Year of the Dog
programme.desc: After her beloved beagle dies, an office worker unsuccessfully searches for ways to fill the void in her life.

programme.title: RoboCop 3
programme.desc: The cyborg policeman (Robert John Burke) takes to the air to defend a run-down neighborhood from a Japanese tycoon.

programme.title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
programme.desc: Doc Holliday (Kirk Douglas) joins Wyatt Earp (Burt Lancaster) and his brothers for a Tombstone showdown with the Clanton gang.

programme.title: Behind Enemy Lines
programme.desc: A former Marine (Thomas Ian Griffith) returns to Vietnam to rescue a comrade (Chris Mulkey) and retrieve nuclear triggers.

programme.title: Ambush
programme.desc: When a small outpost gets ambushed during the Vietnam War, a U.S. Army squad takes the battle below ground for a high-stakes mission unlike anything they've ever seen.

programme.title: Marlowe
programme.desc: Detective Phillip Marlowe becomes embroiled in an investigation with a wealthy family in Bay City, Calif., after a beautiful blonde hires him to find her former lover.

programme.title: John Carpenter's Escape From L.A.
programme.desc: The fascist U.S. president enlists a jailed war hero (Kurt Russell) to retrieve a top-secret device stolen by his daughter on island Los Angeles in 2013.

programme.title: Wrath of Man
programme.desc: A cold and mysterious character working at a cash truck company responsible for moving a lot of money around Los Angeles each week.

programme.title: Gladiator II
programme.desc: Lucius must enter the Colosseum after the powerful emperors of Rome conquer his home. With rage in his heart and the future of the empire at stake, he looks to the past to find the strength and honor needed to return the glory of Rome to its people.

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: A defense attorney hires an enigmatic ex-Army investigator to tackle the case of a highly trained sniper who apparently murdered five people at random.

programme.title: Showgirls
programme.desc: A dancer (Elizabeth Berkley) becomes understudy in a Las Vegas show, sleeps with the boss (Kyle MacLachlan) and pushes the star (Gina Gershon) down a flight of stairs.

programme.title: Torn Hearts
programme.desc: A country music duo seek out the private mansion of their idol and end up in a twisted series of horrors that force them to confront the limits they'd go for their dreams.

programme.title: A House on the Bayou
programme.desc: Hoping for an idyllic getaway, a couple and their daughter visit a remote mansion in rural Louisiana. When suspiciously friendly neighbors show up uninvited, the weekend soon takes a sinister turn as dark secrets test the family's fragile bond.

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: Texas hustler Joe Buck (Jon Voight) works 42nd Street with ailing con man Ratso Rizzo (Dustin Hoffman).

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Accompanied by his eldest son, a Depression-era mob enforcer (Tom Hanks) seeks revenge after the rest of his family are murdered by his employer's (Paul Newman) jealous son.

programme.title: Mississippi Burning
programme.desc: Two FBI agents face racism while investigating the disappearance of three civil rights activists in 1964 Mississippi.

programme.title: September 5
programme.desc: During the 1972 Munich Olympics, an American sports broadcasting crew finds itself thrust into covering the hostage crisis involving Israeli athletes.

programme.title: Air Force One
programme.desc: Demanding the release of a political prisoner, a terrorist and his gang hijack the U.S. president's plane.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqu, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqu, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.
